page.title: 04Drayton Manor
page.content: The Drayton Manor Estate was built in about the 18th Century. The cottage, which used to be the stables for the coach horses is quite fascinating and some of the things are still original like the cobblestones outside the cottage, the beams in the bedrooms, the coach lamps, the stable and the old wall in the garden which divides East Cosham from Drayton. A family named Secor were the original owners. The Stables have been transformed into living rooms, the harness room into a kitchen and what used to be the place for the coaches is now a garage.
